arm_group.description: Remifentanil the basic opioid drug in anesthesia
Sufentanil the basic opioid drug in anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effect on cognitive function, recovery, cardioprotection and haemodynamics
      of standard Remifentanil anaesthesia to standard Sufentanil anaesthesia in patients
      undergoing coronary artery bypass with or without aortic valve replacement.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remifentanil/Sufentanil for CABG+/-AVR Evaluated by Recovery, Cognitive Function, Haemodynamics and Biochemical Markers.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Haemodynamic effects, evaluated by invasive haemodynamic data (arterial line and PAC)
           of opioid given as single drug and in combination with Propofol (first 30 patients
           only).

        2. Cognitive dysfunction evaluated by standard test preoperative and postoperative day 1,
           4 and 30

        3. Recovery quality and time parameters using objective ICU score criteria

        4. Cardioprotection effect evaluated by myocardial biochemical markers obtained
           preoperative and postoperative 4, 9 and 18 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients scheduled for coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) +/- aortic valve
             replacement (AVR)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Ejection Fraction < 30%

          -  Previous Myocardial Infarction within 4 weeks

          -  Severe pulmonary hypertension (mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP)  >  33% of mean
             arterial pressure (MAP)

          -  Arterial hypertension (Sap > 180, Dap > 110)

          -  Diabetes, Non- and Insulin dependent

          -  Non usable echocardiography windows

intervention.description: Randomization to receive Remifentanil (ultrashort acting opioid) as basic opioid in anaesthesia
Randomization to receive Sufentanil (medium/long acting opioid) as basic opioid in anaesthesia

clinical_study.official_title: Fast-track in Cardiac Surgery. Remifentanyl & Sufentanil Anaesthesia for CABG+/-AVR Evaluated by Recovery, Cognitive Dysfunction, Haemodynamics (PAC/TTE) and Cardiac Biochemical Markers (CKMB, TNT, Pro-BNP)

other_outcome.description:
Evaluation of haemodynamic indexes (cardiac index, stroke volume index, central venous oxygenation, blood pressure, Heart rate) together with echocardiographic evaluation of systolic and diastolic function.
Evaluation both by single opioid and combination with propofol
other_outcome.time_frame: From induction anaesthesia until cardiopulmonary bypass

other_outcome.description: Evaluation based on myocardial biochemical markers CK-MB, Troponin-T and Nt-Pro-BNP preoperative and 4, 9 and 15 and 40 hours after surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care, Aarhus University Hospital

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description: Cognitive function evaluated by Palo Alto Veterans Hospital Test on all patients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Estimation on hours in ICU before the patients were eligible for discharge from ICU = ICD4 (Total score < 5, and no single score > 2) using an objective ICU score. The ICU score is done each hour after extubation
secondary_outcome.measure: Eligible time to discharge from ICU

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from pre-operative cognitive function to postoperative cognitive function on day 1, 4 and 30 using cognitive function test from Palo Alto Veterans Hospital Test on all patients

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
